perturbation.original_text: 2.10 "Improvement" or "Improvements" means any modification of a process or other technology described in a Patent, and any modification to Technical Information.
perturbation.explanation: By broadly defining 'Improvement' as 'any enhancement,' we remove the crucial link to Patents and Technical Information. This creates uncertainty when Article V refers to Company Improvements, Investor Improvements, and Joint Improvements, as it's no longer explicitly tied to the core intellectual property, impacting ownership and licensing.

perturbation.original_text: 3.02 If the Option is not exercised prior to the expiration of the Option Period, then Company agrees to extend the license grants set forth in Articles 3.00 and 3.01 beyond the expiration of the Option Period, subject to an annual licensing fee paid by Investor to Company. The non- exclusive rights granted to Investor under this Article 3.02 do not include the right to grant sublicenses to Third Parties. The amount and parameters of the annual licensing fee shall be commercially reasonable, as determined by an independent expert who is mutually agreeable to the Parties and whose determination shall be final and binding; provided, however, that if the Parties cannot agree on the independent expert, each Party shall designate an expert of their choice and the two experts designated by the Parties shall work together in good faith to identify and designate a third, independent expert whose determination shall be binding.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.02 If the Option is not exercised prior to the expiration of the Option Period, then Company agrees to extend the license grants set forth in Articles 3.00 and 3.01 beyond the expiration of the Option Period, subject to an annual licensing fee paid by Investor to Company. The non- exclusive rights granted to Investor under this Article 3.02 do not include the right to grant sublicenses to Third Parties.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the mechanism for determining the annual licensing fee after the Option Period, this creates ambiguity. While a fee is mentioned, there is no process described for establishing what is 'commercially reasonable'. This creates uncertainty for both parties and will create dispute.

perturbation.original_text: 18.04 Governing Law; Jurisdiction. All questions concerning the construction, validity, enforcement and interpretation of this IP Agreement shall be determined in accordance with the provisions of the Investment Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 18.04 Governing Law; Jurisdiction. All questions concerning the construction, validity, enforcement and interpretation of this IP Agreement shall be determined in accordance with the laws of New York.
perturbation.explanation: By making an explicit definition of governing law, jurisdiction, and construction while in the original document, the definition was dependent on the "Investment Agreement," it means that the parties have different guiding documents for making decisions and will disagree based on different legal interpretations and enforcement.
